page.title: 02 FARMING IN KENNINGTON
page.content: The area is part of the bottom of the{ {STOUR VALLEY}and became flat by the curling movement of the river through many thousands of years. The { {CANTERBURY ROAD}from {ASHFORD}and { {ASHFORD}to {CANTERBURY RAILWAY}follows the flat valley floor, and became almost the north and south boundaries of the area. The area is very open and has few trees in sight and nearly always seems breezy. The local people called the nearby village{'WINDY WYE'. The soil is good in parts of the area and used for raising crops like wheat, potatoes and strawberries. The locals said that parts were used for growing hops and one hop-drying kiln found in the area is now in use for a farm store. This area is open and farmers used fences instead of hedgrows.
